sanskrit_verse: असंस्कृतान् पशून् मन्त्रैर्नाद्याद्विप्रः कदा चन । मन्त्रैस्तु संस्कृतानद्यात्शाश्वतं विधिमास्थितः ॥ ५.३६॥
transliteration: asaṃskṛtān paśūn mantrair nādyād vipraḥ kadā cana | mantraiḥ tu saṃskṛtān adyāt śāśvataṃ vidhim āsthitaḥ || 5.36 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: A Vipra shall never invoke sacred mantras upon uninitiated beings; only upon those duly consecrated and established in eternal dharma should such invocation be directed.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derivative of alignment with Sanatana Dharma
Causation arises through conscious capacity, not mere intent
Capacity-based responsibility requires prior sacramental preparation
Restoration logic demands precise channeling of sacred energy
Consciousness alignment necessitates ritual and spiritual fitness
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent_is_vipra AND target_is_uninitiated THEN action_invalid
IF agent_is_vipra AND target_is_consecrated THEN action_valid
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters involving ritual authority or sacred invocation, the threshold for validity rests on the recipient's preparedness as per shastric protocol. The court must verify samskaric eligibility before recognizing efficacy.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that causal flow depends on recipient readiness. Misaligned invocation does not incur punitive consequence but necessitates corrective realignment. Responsibility follows capacity, not fault.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate completion process for improperly invoked rituals
Realign consciousness of both invoker and recipient
Restore energetic integrity through compensatory samskaras
Establish clarity around lawful invocation thresholds
Integrate learning into future ritual execution frameworks
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands executed: ritual power flows only where consciousness is prepared. Dharma is restored. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone adjudicates.
